title: Château Haut-Brion 2015 Le Clarté  (Pessac-Léognan)
description: This second wine comes from both La Mission Haut-Brion and Haut-Brion vineyards. It has great fruit, crisp acidity and a lemon and grapefruit fruitiness. A tang to the texture lifts the wine into crispness as well as acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Château La Garricq 2015  Moulis-en-Médoc
description: This wine comes from a six-acre property under the same ownership as Château Paloumey. It has 20% Petit Verdot in the blend, giving it both the tannins and the dark color. It is a structured wine, rich in black plums and densely textured. The wine will be ready to drink from 2024.

title: Ambrogio e Giovanni Folonari 2014 Torcalvano  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Made entirely with Sangiovese, this lively medium-bodied red opens with aromas of new leather, red plum and a whiff of peppercorn. The bright palate offers tart red cherry, white pepper and a hint of pomegranate alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Arpepe 2015 Rosso  (Valtellina)
description: Delicate scents of wild berry, star anise and alpine herb float out of the glass. On the polished palate, supple tannins lightly support juicy Marasca cherry, strawberry preserve and clove. A mineral note wraps up the finish.

title: Atticus 2014 Atticus Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This tight, sharply defined wine shows sculpted raspberry fruit, focused and amplified with light suggestions of orange peel and chocolate. A mix of Dijon and Pommard clones, it spent 11 months in 40% new French oak, finishing with a touch of peppery herbs.

title: Black Pearl 2015 Oro Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (Coastal Region)
description: This is a dense and seductive blend, with brooding yet enticing aromas of mocha, cocoa-dusted cherry, brambly berry and black forest cake. The medium-weight palate is plush and smooth, but not overdone, framed by ample acidity and velvety tannins that lend structure to the rich dark-fruit flavors. Final notes of black pepper, olive and toasted oak unfold on the enduring finish. Drink now–2021.

title: Clos des Menuts 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: This rich and dense wine shines with ripe Merlot, a product of the warm vintage. Dusty tannins, licorice and black-fruit flavors and plenty of spice from wood aging all contribute to the generally ripe effect of this generous wine. Drink from 2023.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Layers of roasted beef, blackberry compote, pepper, tarragon and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime Paso Robles producer. The palate combines New World richness with Old World elegance, offering dried plums, spice cake and pecan flavors.

title: Caven 2010 Sassella La Priora Riserva  (Valtellina Superiore)
description: You'll find red berry, rose petal and thyme aromas on this fresh mountain Nebbiolo. The savory palate offers crushed raspberry, cinnamon and white pepper alongside polished tannins.

title: Di Giorgio Family Wines 2016 Chardonnay (Coonawarra)
description: This Coonawarra Chard is less about the fruit and more about oak and malo characters like melted butter, toasted nuts and copper penny, with prickly acidity wrapped in an oily texture. It's a versatile food wine, ready to drink now or to cellar through 2023.

title: Domaine Schoffit 2016 Tradition Muscat (Alsace)
description: A hint of ripe peach joins the rose and honeysuckle notes on the nose. The palate seems to have a smidgeon of sweetness, boosting the rose and peach notes. There also is an earthy, pithy textural grip to the rich palate. This is concentrated fresh but intense with an off-dry finish.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Claret (Paicines)
description: Four Bordeaux varieties work as a team in this bottling to deliver aromas of blackberry jam, caramel, roasted cocoa, peppercorn and dark soil. There's great cohesion to the palate, where black cherry, hints of root beer and purple flowers ride buoyant acidity and chalky tannins.

title: Dr. Fischer 2016 Bockstein Ockfen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pronounced aromas of smoke and struck flint dissipate into zesty tangerine, grapefruit and lime on the palate of this juicy, lip smacking kabinett. Delicately sweet but impeccably balanced in acidity, it's a spry, revitalizing wine to enjoy now though 2021.

title: Dr. Nägler 2016 Steinkaut Rüdesheimer Trocken Erste Lage Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Waxy apple skins, green-apple and lime tones meld gorgeously in this medium-bodied but texturally rich Riesling. Dry in style, it's refreshingly brisk, with a lingering lime-pith finish. Drink now through 2025.

title: Dusted Valley 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas are pitch black, with notes of blackberry, black cherry, vanilla and anise, showing the warmth of the vintage. The palate is rich and ripe, packing a big punch of dark-fruit flavors.

title: Enrico Gatti NV Brut Nature  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of wild flower, yellow stone fruit and a whiff of hazelnut float out of the glass. The vibrant palate offers peach, yellow apple and nectarine alongside a hint of brioche. A lively refined perlage provides the backdrop.

title: Estrin 2012 Cabernet Franc (Wahluke Slope)
description: This is mostly Riverbend Vineyard fruit topped off with Red Mountain Vineyard Merlot (7%). Herb, cranberry and cherry aromas are followed by rich, full-bodied black-fruit flavors. It brings richness and intensity but stays in balance.

title: Fitz-Ritter 2016 Dürkheimer Abtsfronhof Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Hints of smoke and struck flint lend a deep mineral undertone to crisp green apple, gooseberry and lime in this dry, full-bodied Riesling. It's satisfyingly rich in mouthfeel yet vivaciously spry. The lemon-lime finish is lean and lingering.

title: Gianfranco Fino 2015 Es  (Primitivo del Salento)
description: This iconic Primitivo from winemaker Gianfranco Fino delivers in its dense aromas of spiced cranberry, blackberry, violets and tilled earth. There's weight and intensity to the palate in all aspects, from the punchy, juicy berry and dark plum flavors to the racing acidity and bracing tannins. Time in the cellar to soften the sharp edges will reward with the already developing complexities. Drink from 2022.

title: Guado al Melo 2015 Atis  (Bolgheri Superiore)
description: A blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc, this wine opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, bell pepper and cedar. The concentrated palate offers blackberry jam, clove and licorice alongside solid, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Hamacher 2013 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The opening scents bring traces of citrus, leather and vanilla, and such flavors are subtly conveyed in the mouth. Compact red berries with dried Italian herbs distinguish the midpalate, and the tannins are substantial and firm up the finish.

title: Hayotzer 2014 Lyrica Meritage (Galilee)
description: Aromas of blackberry, apple peel and juniper berry set the stage for slightly tart flavors of cherry, pomegranate and eucalyptus. Soft tannins and bright fruit glide across the palate, making way for a cranberry and mint finish.

title: JCP Maltus 2015 Le Nardian  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: Perfumed Muscadelle gives a great lift to this wine with its smooth texture and crisp lemon and apple flavors. Touches of toast add spice. It is a wine with great fruitiness just hinting at minerality. Drink from late 2018.

title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2016 Réserve Muscat (Alsace)
description: A wonderfully subtle but pure lemon note rises from the glass, accompanied by a hint of jasmine. The light palate that follows is also bathed in lemon and summer blossom notes, but in an understated, refreshing way. The finish is whistle-clean and dry.

title: Laelaps 2016 Nemarniki Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Tasted a few months ahead of its official release, this is a bright, fresh mix of cranberry, raspberry and cherry fruit. The flavors are crisp and clear, and the mouthfeel is already supple, with citrus highlights. It should be drinking quite nicely by the back half of this year.

title: Lantieri NV Extra Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Bread dough, orange zest, pressed wildflower and white stone-fruit aromas mingle in the glass together with a whiff of ginger. The fresh palate reflects the nose, offering yellow apple, Bartlett pear, citrus and toasted hazelnut set against bright acidity and a lively perlage.

title: Le Marchesine 2013 Blanc de Noir Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: Aromas of medicinal herb, bread crust and wild cherry follow over to the lively palate along with pink grapefruit, thyme and mineral. Bright acidity and an invigorating perlage accompany the bright flavors while a note of bitter walnut marks the close.

title: Maurice Schoech & Fils 2016 Côtes d'Ammerschwihr White (Alsace)
description: An earthy, mellow and ripe notion of pear is foremost on the nose, joined by pleasantly spiky lemon zestiness. It is the lemon freshness that takes the lead on the slender, dry palate. This is clean, vivid and moreish.

title: Merriman 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: From Pommard and Wädenswil clones, this tart and tasty wine brings cranberry and raspberry fruit, lively and acid-driven. Highlights of lemon curd and orange marmalade add further interest, and it's a clean and refreshing wine all the way through the finish.
